info.title: TruckMate REST API
info.description:
The TruckMate REST APIs are a comprehensive set of RESTful services, allowing you to seamlessly integrate with major TruckMate product areas. The TruckMate REST APIs allow developers to integrate the TruckMate product with custom or 3rd party applications, automate tasks, and much more.

Business use cases of the TruckMate REST APIs include:


- Internal systems: Use the APIs to share data and streamline internal business processes.
- External data sharing: In addition to internal networking, the APIs allow sharing TruckMate data with third party systems to connect and share information.
- App integrations: Access TruckMate data in real time.
- Embedded content: Request data from the TruckMate REST APIs to embed pieces of content onto your corporate site.

The endpoints and methods available are dependent on the license keys and authorization methods used. Use the following documentation to determine how to interact with the various available components.

[Download latest released OpenAPI](https://truckmatecloudhub.trimble-transportation.com/tm/openapi.json "download")


 This documentation is based on the most currently released version of TruckMate. Documentation for previous versions can be accessed by navigating to the openapi.json endpoint for any given API (the service must be set up and running). For example: http://DOMAIN/openapi.json

tags.name: Appointments
tags.description: The Appointments API allows e-commerce partners to select a delivery appointment for orders not yet created in TruckMate. The list of available appointment windows can be constrained to be not earlier than the Earliest Delivery Date provided by TruckMate's Transit Time API, to ensure that delivery appointments are feasible according to service standards.

tags.name: Cloud Events
tags.description: Cloud Events allow submitting event data in common formats to provide interoperability across services.

tags.name: Documents
tags.description:
The Documents API allows for public viewing of specific imaging documents through a URL linked with a time sensitive token.
Synergize by Microdea is currently the only Document Management System supported by the TruckMate Documents API. The Synergize SOAP API is used to retrieve documents from the configured repository.
Document Type must be one of the document types configured in Codes Maintenance > Imaging configured for the ART.EXE.

tags.name: Login
tags.description: The login authentication endpoints are used to generate a JWT (JSON Web Token) to be used as the authorization bearer token for subsequent API calls. Web users and their login credentials are configured either through the Profiles > TruckMate Customer and Vendor Profiles application  > TM4Web Configuration tab. TM4Web Access Group configuration options are setup in the TruckMate for Web > Web Admin application.

tags.name: Order Customs
tags.description: The TruckMate Order Customs API allows access to retrieve, create and update TruckMate Order Customs information. Customs Information for an order can be viewed in the TruckMate Customer Service application > Customs tab.

tags.name: Orders
tags.description:
The TruckMate Orders API allows access to TruckMate orders, rate quotes and pickup requests.

Orders refers to the freight bills created and managed by TruckMate for dispatch operations, billing, collections, and the General Ledger. Orders contain details about pickup, delivery, routing, load details, dangerous goods information, status history, trace numbers, rates, charges, extra charges, quotes, and more. 

Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the TruckMate Customer Service application where you can enter and manage additional information about costs and expenses related to the freight bill. These include interliner charges, COD on freight, and freight bill based driver pay.

Pickup requests are viewed in the TruckMate Order Preprocessor application.

Child resources of the orders, rate quotes and pickup requests are found on their individual tabs within the associated Windows applications.

The endpoints, methods and features available are dependent on the authorization methods used.

tags.name: Reports
tags.description:
The TruckMate Reports API allows for retrieval and generation of Crystal and Zebra reports that are configured in TruckMate. Report parameters can be included when the API is used for report generation.

Reports are encoded in base64 and can be converted to text formats such as PDF using a valid converter tool. Reports are configured and can be generated using the TruckMate Crystal Report Launcher application.

tags.name: Transit Times
tags.description: Retrieves transit times using TruckMate's Service Level Matrix to calculate estimated delivery dates given pickup and delivery locations, service level(s) and pickup date(s).

tags.name: Trip Reefer Monitoring
tags.description: The TruckMate Trip Reefer Monitoring API allows access to retrieve TruckMate Trip Reefer Monitoring information.

tags.name: Trips
tags.description:
The TruckMate Trips API allows access to TruckMate trips. Trips can have resources assigned such as orders, carriers, drivers, power units and trailers. LTL and single leg based trips can be created using the TruckMate Trips API.

Trips can be viewed in the TruckMate Dispatch and Multi-Mode Dispatch applications where further additional dispatch related operations can be performed such as trip optimization, parking trips at doors and more.

The endpoints, methods and features available are dependent on the authorization methods used.

tags.name: userFieldsData
tags.description: Retrieves, and updates User Field entries for a specified type. User fields of order and order interliner can be viewed in the Customer Service application. User fields of trip carrier can be viewed in the Dispatch or Multi Mode Dispatch applications. The user field configuration can be viewed in the the Codes Maintenance application > Custom Defined Fields tab> User Fields sub-tab.

tags.name: Version
tags.description: The version endpoint allows the ART server version information to be retrieved. This will include the version number of the TruckMate ART Server (Windows Service) application.

tags.name: Web Address Book
tags.description: Retrieves, creates and updates TM4Web address book entries. TM4WEB address book entries can be viewed in the TruckMate Web Administration program > Client Features > Contacts tab > Address Book sub-tab. The TM4Web address book allows customers to provide contact addresses to their web users which may not yet be clients configured within TruckMate's Customer Profile application. These non-existent contacts should be reviewed in the Order Preprocessor program at which time the employee can decide if the contact already exists in Customer Profiles and change it to this, or if this is a new contact and needs to be added.

tags.name: Web Users
tags.description: Retrieves, creates and updates TM4Web users. TM4Web users can be viewed and maintained in the TruckMate Customer & Vendor Profiles program on the TM4Web Configuration tab. TM4Web users can log into the TM4Web application (TruckMate's web-based, self-service portal). TM4Web credentials can also be used with API calls to retrieve orders based on some of their associated Web Administration configuration options through the TruckMate REST API > GET Orders endpoint.

tags.name: Whoami
tags.description: Retrieves identity of the user associated with the provided authorization method.

get.description: Retrieves an array of pre-booked appointments providing visibility to appointments made. The filter query parameter allows searching for specific appointments (e.g., by customer and/or external identifier). Use the optional limit and offset query parameters to page through the resulting sets of data.

post.description: Creates a single new pre-booked appointment. Use the external identifier and source fields to uniquely identify the external system that is maintaining this appointment. A valid TruckMate customer who is placing this appointment is required. The appointment type, either pickup or delivery, is also required.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the properties of the new appointment to be created.

get.description: Retrieves a pre-booked appointment as specified by the appointment identifier in the target path parameter.

put.description: Updates a pre-booked appointment as specified by the appointment identifier in the target path parameter. Can be used for partial updates as only the properties sent in the request will be updated. Will return a 409 Conflict response if the appointment has already been matched to an order.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the properties to be updated. All fields are optional, but at least one field must be sent.

post.description:
Cloud Events allow submitting event data in common formats to provide interoperability across services.

The type attribute describes the type of event related to the originating occurrence.

There are currently 9 supported types:

 **noMatchingCarriers**

Before the tendering has even commenced waterfalling, this type would be submitted when the Routing Guide in TTC fails to match any carriers to the route per the IP record's Start to End zone. The result is a failed waterfall.

 **noEligibleCarriers**

Before the tendering has even commenced waterfalling, this type would be submitted when no eligible carriers have been found per the carriers provided by the Routing Guide. The result is a failed waterfall.

 **noRatedCarriers**

Before the tendering has even commenced waterfalling, this type would be submitted when no rates could be calculated per the list of eligible carriers. The result is a failed waterfall.

 **exceptionOccurred**

Before or once the tendering has commenced waterfalling, this type would be submitted only when a miscellaneous exception has occurred for any reason. The result is a failed waterfall.

 **sendEDI**

Instruct the TMS to send an EDI 204 to the carrier.

 **sendEDICancellation**

Instruct the TMS to send an EDI Cancellation to the carrier due to timeout or user cancellation in TTC.

 **created**

Used for informational purposes only, to indicate that the tender has been created in TTC. Expected to contain an array of 1 or more carriers. The first carrier to tender will have a status of 'IN_PROGRESS'. All other carriers will have a status of 'PENDING'.

 **updated**

Used for informational purposes only, to indicate that the tender has been updated in TTC. Expected to contain an array of 1 or more carriers. One carrier is expected to have a status of 'IN_PROGRESS'. All other carriers will have a status of either 'PENDING', 'REJECTED' or 'EXPIRED'.

 **completed**

Indicates that the Waterfall Tender is complete with either one or none of the carriers accepting ('ACCEPT') the load or user has canceled in TTC with a status of 'REJECTED', 'EXPIRED', 'TERMINATED' or 'CANCELED'.

get.description: Retrieves document configuration records.

parameters.name: searchValue
parameters.description: A search value that is used to look up documents in the imaging repository (e.g. TruckMate Bill Number)

get.summary: Retrieve a document from the image system
get.description:
Retrieves a document from the imaging server.
The document type and document identifier path parameters are used along with the token provided in the query string to determine access to the document.
Documents will be converted and returned in the specified document format (only PDF is supported at this time).

As of TruckMate 25.1, the documentId parameter can be used to provide the specific identifier when more than one document exists for a matching documentType and documentIdentifier.

parameters.name: documentFormat
parameters.description: Format in which to return document (only PDF is supported currently)

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Identifier used when more than one document exists for a given matching document type and document identifier

post.description:
Generates a time sensitive token to be used in subsequent calls to retrieve the specific document from the imaging system.
The document type, as configured in the imaging system, and a document identifier, such as bill number, are required path parameters.
TruckMate API Credentials are required to generate the access token. The user configured in the TruckMate ART Server Administrator to run the TruckMate API Service provides the profile that determines which imaging documents can be accessed for generating the access token.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the length of time the token should be valid. Default expiry is one week, if no payload is provided.

get.description: Retrieves a new JWT (JSON Web Token) with a updated expiry time based on the supplied JWT authorization.

post.description: Generates and returns a JWT based on the supplied login credentials. The JWT can then be used as the authorization bearer token with subsequent API calls.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the username and password of a TM4Web user.

post.summary: Create a new order, pickup request or rate quote
post.description:
Creates one or more order, pickup request or rate quote records.

The following fields will be defaulted based on the following app config options:

* CSERV.EXE > Default Bill To

* CSERV.EXE > Default Site

 Other configuration options can affect how certain field values are populated if not provided in the request:

* startZone - defaults to the provided shipper zone or the shipper's default zone

* endZone - defaults to the provided consignee zone

* serviceLevel - defaults to Codes Maintenance > Site Setup > Service Level default

The billToCode can only be updated using the billTo override (R) option.

The interliner (I) option for billTo can only be used if there is at least one interliner record with that has a receivable chargesType option set.

Duplicate PO is not allowed on traceNumber for the same billTo when the app config option CSERV.EXE > Check PO is set.

 Extra Stops (XStop) child bills can be created using the masterOrderId query parameter in TruckMate versions 25.1.2 and higher.

* The order(s) included in the request body will be created as xStops for the orderId that is used as the masterOrderId query parameter value.

* The masterOrderId must be a valid posted orderId that is not a pickup request or quote and cannot be interfaced to billing.

* The orders included in the request body when creating xStops must have a billToCode, siteId and currencyCode that matches the masterOrderId.

 Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the  Customer Service application.

Pickup requests can be viewed in the Order Preprocessor application.

App config options can be viewed in the Application Configurator application.

requestBody.description: The $select system query option allows clients to requests a specific set of properties for each entity or complex type.

parameters.name: copyOrderId
parameters.description: Create a new order or rate quote from an existing order or rate quote

parameters.name: saveAsDraft

get.summary: Retrieve an order, pickup request, or rate quote
get.description:
Retrieves a specific order, pickup request, or rate quote record.

Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the Customer Service application.

The ratingTerms field will only return a value if the following app config option is enabled.

   - RATES.EXE > Terms Rate Precedence

Pickup requests can be viewed in the Order Preprocessor application.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

put.summary: Update an order, pickup request or rate quote
put.description:
Updates one or more properties of the specified order, pickup request or rate quote record.

Only active orders, or pickup requests associated with the authentication key used to access the endpoint can be updated.

* Approved pickup requests cannot be updated.

* Orders must be posted (have a bill number) and cannot be cancelled or interfaced to billing.

Not all of the Security Configuration > Security > Business Events settings for Customer Service which allow or prevent editing of orders based on tab, status and other options are used by the APIs.

The requested body may include child resources such as details, dangerousGoods, customDefs, etc. Keep in mind when a resource is specified in the body, it will do a complete replace of that resource. In other words, it will DELETE ALL records of the specified resource in the order, and insert new ones from the request body.

To update an individual child record use the PUT method directly against the child resource record itself.

* For example, to update an individual detail line use PUT /orders/{orderId}/details/{orderDetailId}

Note that the API cannot edit or delete a Cash-On-Delivery (COD) record for an order but it can update the codAmount. If no COD record exists for the order, the API will create it.

The estimatedDeliveryDate will be updated based on the following app config option:

* CSERVE.EXE > Reset Estimated Delivery Date Value When Delivery Date of Freight Bill Changed

The billToCode can only be updated using the billTo override (R) option.

The interliner (I) option for billTo can only be used if there is at least one interliner record with that has a receivable chargesType option set.

Duplicate PO is not allowed on traceNumber for the same billTo when the app config option CSERV.EXE > Check PO is set.

Orders and rate quotes can be viewed in the Customer Service application.

Pickup requests can be viewed in the Order Preprocessor application.

COD records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > COD tab.

requestBody.description: Save the order as a draft - incomplete web status for pickup requests or an entry truckload order

parameters.name: saveAsDraft
parameters.description: Save the order as a draft - incomplete web status for pickup requests or an entry truckload order

Retrieves billing information for the specified order.

Billing can be viewed in the Customer Service application > billing tab.

Retrieves the bill to information record for the specified order. Bill to information is derived from the client profile which corresponds to the order billToCode. 

If the client profile that corresponds to the order billToCode has a 3rd party billing client, the bill to information will be derived from the 3rd party billing client profile. 

Bill to information can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Billing tab. 

3rd party billing information can be viewed in the Customer and Vendor Profiles application > Billing tab.

get.summary: Retrieve order care of delivery information
get.description:

Care of delivery information can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Contacts tab > Care Of Delivery section.

Retrieves checklist item records for the specified order.

Checklist items (such as tasks or required documents) are based on the 'Bill To' Customer Code and
are required before an order can go through the approval process and onto the dispatching process.
Checklist items can be edited as long as the order is not approved. Once the order is approved,
the ability to edit checklist items becomes subject to a Security Setup option.

Checklist items are defined in the Codes Maintenance application > Checklist Items tab.

Checklist items are assigned to a particular customer in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Freight Bill Check-List tab.
When a Customer Code that has checklist items entered against it is used as the 'Bill To' code on an order,
the checklist items must be fulfilled before approving the order and moving it onto the dispatch process.

Checklist items can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Check List tab.

Retrieves a checklist item record for the specified order.

Checklist items (such as tasks or required documents) are based on the 'Bill To' Customer Code and
are required before an order can go through the approval process and onto the dispatching process.
Checklist items can be edited as long as the order is not approved. Once the order is approved,
the ability to edit checklist items becomes subject to a Security Setup option.

Checklist items are defined in the Codes Maintenance application > Checklist Items tab.

Checklist items are assigned to a particular customer in the Customer & Vendor Profiles application > Freight Bill Check-List tab.
When a Customer Code that has checklist items entered against it is used as the 'Bill To' code on an order,
the checklist items must be fulfilled before approving the order and moving it onto the dispatch process.

Checklist items can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Check List tab.

get.description:
Retrieves dangerous goods records for the specified order.

Dangerous goods records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Dang. Goods tab.

post.description:
Adds one or more dangerous goods records to the specified order.

The endpoint is designed for use by companies who do not link commodities to the UN Number dangerous goods code. If internal commodity codes are configured to be linked to the UN Number data, the relevant commodities can be added to the order's detail line via the existing /orders/{orderId}/details/ endpoint.

The unNumber is required and will auto populate any of the dangerous goods fields which are not provided within the request.

UN Numbers are set up in the TruckMate Bulk Codes Maintenance application.

Dangerous goods records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Dang. Goods tab.

requestBody.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the new dangerous goods records to add to the order.

parameters.name: onlyPostedResults
parameters.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the custom defined field to be created

Dangerous goods records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Dang. Goods tab.

 If the unNumber is included in the request, all other endpoint fields not included in the request will be updated based on the related settings from the Bulk Codes Maintenance application.

 Dangerous goods records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Dang. Goods tab.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the properties to be updated. All fields are optional, but at least one field must be sent.

The order details contain specific information about the order, such as: warnings, commodity, load dimensions, rating information and more. A single order can have one or more order detail records.

Order details can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Details tab.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

post.description:
Adds one or more detail line records to a specified order.

The order details contain specific information about the order, such as: warnings, commodity, load dimensions, rating information and more. A single order can have several order detail records.

Order details can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Details tab.

requestBody.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the details to add to the order.

parameters.name: onlyPostedResults
parameters.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the custom defined field to be created

get.description:
Retrieves a detail line record for the specified order.

Order details can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Details tab.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand applicable sub-resources separated by comma.

put.description:
Updates one or more properties of a detail record for the specified order.

The order details contain specific information about the order, such as: warnings, commodity, load dimensions, rating information and more. A single order can have several order detail records.

The requested body may include the barcodes child resource. Keep in mind when a resource is specified in the body, it will do a complete replace of that resource. In other words, it will DELETE ALL barcode records on the specified detail line, and insert new ones from the request body.

To update an individual record, the barcodeId value can be included in the request to indicate which specific barcode record will be updated.

If none of the barcodes included in the request have a barcodeId, it will do a complete replace of the barcodes resource. In other words, it will DELETE ALL barcode records on the specified detail line, and insert new ones from the request body.

If an array of barcode records is included in the request body that has both records with a barcodeId and others without a barcodeId, the barcodes records that correspond to the included barcodeId will be updated. New barcode records will be created for those sent without a barcodeId.

Updating the entire barcodes resource at this level is not allowed for orders which have already been picked up.

Order details can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Details tab.

requestBody.description: An JSON object containing the properties of the details to be updated to the order.

delete.description:
Deletes a detail record for the specified order.

The order details contain specific information about the order, such as: warnings, commodity, load dimensions, rating information and more. A single order can have several order detail records.

Order details can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Details tab.

Retrieves interliner records for the specified order.

Interliner accessorial charges for the specified order can be retrieved using the aCharges property.

The pickupLocation retrieves zone information relating to the fromZone on the interliner record. If the fromZone is a terminal zone associated with a terminal client profile,  the pickupLocation retrieves terminal client profile information. For interliner records with an advance movementType, the pickupLocation retrieves the specified order pickupAt information.

The dropLocation retrieves zone information relating to the toZone on the interliner record. If the toZone is a terminal zone associated with a terminal client profile, the dropLocation retrieves terminal client profile information. For interliner records with a beyond movementType, the dropLocation retrieves the specified order careOf contact.

Interliner records can be viewed in the Customer Service application > I/P tab.

Interliner accessorial charges can be viewed in the Customer Service application > IP tab > Extra tab.

Client profile records can be viewed in the Customer and Vendor Profiles application.

Terminal records can be viewed in the Terminal Maintenance application.

Zone records can be viewed in the Codes Maintenance > Zone tab.

get.description:
Retrieves note records for the specified order.

Notes can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Summary tab > Notes button.

post.description:
Adds one or more note records to the specified order.

The note can be any note type including:

* **B** - Billing
* **C** - Container
* **D** - Driver
* **S** - OSD
* **O** - Other
* **W** - Write-Off
* **1** - User 1
* **2** - User 2
* **3** - User 3

The **I** - Import note type is read-only and cannot be created through this API.

When the noteType being passed does not exist for the freight bill, the note will be inserted into the freight bill as a new note record.

When the noteType being passed already exists on the freight bill, the note will be appended to existing note records of that same type into the freight bill.

If the note being entered resolves to a note of either **Journal** or **Notes+AutoDate** style, the note will automatically be stamped with the date/time of insertion and the user ID associated to the API Key used to make the request.

If the note of this note type does not already exist in the order, a new note will be inserted. Otherwise, a new note is appended to the existing note base using the **Note Entry Style** app config option.

Users are granted the edit and view permission for each note type in Security > Notes > Customer Service Notes tab. Without the edit permission, the POST request will return error 403 (Forbidden).

Notes can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Summary tab > Notes button.

App config options can be viewed in the Application Configurator application.

put.summary: Apply a freight bill based status change
put.description:
Allows the status of a freight bill to be updated for scenarios where there is no associated trip.

The status code sent in the request must be defined to apply to a freight bill and must be active.

* Entry (N)
* Availability (V)
* Docked (K)
* Completion (C)
* Cancel (X)
* Administrative (R), restricted to users with Business Event 'Allow Edit of Freight Bill Status (Administrative)' 

The optional user fields included in the request can be used to apply values to the user fields in the Status History grid for the related order. The user making the request requires the 'Allow Edit/Delete of Status History' permission  found in the Security Configuration application > Security > Business Events > Allow Changes section.

The following app config options also need to be configured in a manner that allows for the user fields to be editable.

* CSERV.EXE > Status History - Editable Fields
* CSERV.EXE > Status History - Editable Status Codes
* CSERV.EXE > Status Nav Bar

For LTL status changes the Trips API must be used.

The current status of an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Status tab.

App config options can be viewed in the Application Configurator application.

Retrieves trip records. 

Trips can be viewed in the TruckMate Dispatch or Multi Mode Dispatch applications.

parameters.name: expand

post.description:
Creates a new trip record.

**P&D trip:**

* The pickupDeliveryTrip flag must be set to _True_.

* The fromZone and toZone values must be set to the same terminal zone to indicate the same start and end point.

* If a valid routeId associated with the desired terminal is provided, then the fromZone and toZone values are not required.

* The stops array can also be included to assign orders and create stops. If an order cannot be assigned, the trip will be partially created (202 response) and placed into the trip status designated as the default when planning incomplete in Codes Maintenance > Status codes > Additional Rules tab.

* Partially created trips will have trip notes entered that explain the items encountered which resulted in the trip being partially created.

* The controls function to deassign orders from matching trips can be used to deassign orders specified in the stops array from other matching trips. If one or more orders cannot be deassigned successfully, the trip will be partially created with trip notes explaining why.

**Leg based trip:**

* A fromZone and toZone are required.

 The maximum number of resources that can be assigned to a trip will depend on the following app config options:

* DISPATCH.EXE > Max Drivers per Leg

* DISPATCH.EXE > Max Misc per Leg

* DISPATCH.EXE > Max Power per Leg

* DISPATCH.EXE > Max Trlrs per Leg

 Trips can be viewed in the TruckMate Dispatch or Multi Mode Dispatch applications.

 App config options can be viewed in the Application Configurator application.

post.summary: Assign a carrier to a trip
post.description:
Assigns a carrier record to the specified trip.

 The carrierId must be a valid TruckMate vendor of type: Interliner, Agent (Carrier) or Linehaul Carrier.

 Carriers will be assigned to all active and planned legs of the specified trip.

 Currency for the carrier cost is based on the following app config option:

* CSERV.EXE > Interliner Currency

 The accessorial charge code, if included, follows these rules:

* The currency of the accessorial charge code as defined in the Codes Maintenance application must match the carrier cost currency.

* If the accessorial charge quantity and rate are provided, then the amount returned will be the quantity and rate multiplied together.

* If the accessorial charge amount is provided, quantity and rate do not need to be included.

 The costAllocationRule had the following enum options added:

* Enum value 'length' was added in TruckMate 24.4.

* Enum values 'pallet' and 'pieces' were added in TruckMate 25.3.

* Using these enum values for the costAllocationRule field in prior versions will result in an invalidEnum error being returned.

* The TruckMate ART server version can be verified using the version endpoint.

 Carrier information for a trip can be viewed on the Customer Service application > I/P tab and on the Trips grid in the Dispatch and Multi Mode Dispatch applications. These Trip grids also provide access to the Find Carrier Near window and other carrier functions that can assign carriers to a trip.

 App config options can be viewed in the Application Configurator application

put.summary: Apply a (LTL) status change to an order on a trip
put.description:
Applies a freight bill based LTL (less-than-load) status change record to a specific order assigned to the specified trip.

 The status code sent in the request must be active, and must be defined to apply to a freight Bill.

 The behaviour of the status code sent with the request must be one of:

* Dispatch (D)

* Depart Consignee (E)

* Arrive Shipper / Pickup (P)

* Spotting (S)

* Terminal (T)

* Docked (K)

* Other (O)

* Arrive at Dock (1)

* Depart Dock (2)

* Depart Shipper (3)

* Arrive Consignee (4)

* Completion (C)

 For LTL status changes, some status codes may not be allowed if a previous status has not yet been applied. For example, a spotload/terminal status change cannot be applied if the trip has not been dispatched.

 An order cannot be cancelled directly through a LTL status change, the order must first be deassigned from the trip before it can be cancelled.

 The zoneIdLookup field can be used in place of the zone code field in the request to use the zone that matches the longitude and latitude provided in the request, the orderâs pickup or care of delivery zone.

 The threshold for the value entered as the time for the status update will depend on the following app config option:

* Date Tolerances > DISPATCH.EXE > TRIP_STATUS_CHANGE_DATE

 The current status of an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Status tab. The current status of a trip can be viewed from the Dispatch application > Trips grid or any of the Multi Mode Dispatch application > trips grids.

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the properties of the status change. Both the status code and zone must be sent with the request.

post.description:
Adds latitude and longitude position updates to the specified trip between status updates. 

 The GPS data for resources can then be viewed on Trimble Maps by enabling GPS Pings for a Trip. 

 The Position History of the Trip, including Last Poll Location, Zone and Date of the resources on the trip, being driver, power, trailer, undelivered freight will also be updated if the following app config is set to _True_:

* COMMGR.EXE > Track On Trip

 A new "POSITION" record will be added to the Status History, with the location description used as the status entry comment.

 The current position for power units, trailers, trips and orders is typically updated using mobile GPS devices and applications like Trimble D2Link.

 A trip's position information can be viewed on the freight bills grid within the Dispatch and Multi Mode Dispatch applications and from the Customer Service application > Status tab for undelivered freight bills assigned to the trip.

 App config options can be viewed in the Application Configurator application.

requestBody.description: An array of JSON objects containing the properties of the position update to apply to the trip.

put.summary: Apply a TL status change to a trip
put.description:
Applies a trip based TL (truckload) status change to an existing trip.

 The status code sent in the request must be active, and must be defined to apply to a trip.

 The behaviour of the status code sent with the request must be one of:

* Dispatch (D)

* Depart Consignee (E)

* Late (L)

* Arrive Shipper / Pickup (P)

* Spotting (S)

* Terminal (T)

* Docked (K)

* Other (O)

* Arrive at Dock (1)

* Depart Dock (2)

* Depart Shipper (3)

* Arrive Consignee (4)

* Assignment (A)

* Completion (C)

 The zoneIdLookup field can be used in place of the zone code field in the request to use the zone that matches the longitude and latitude provided in the request, or other zone code values associated with the specified trip.

 Trips must be cancelled through the DELETE method on the specific trip endpoint.

 The threshold for the value entered as the time for the status update will depend on the following app config option:

* Date Tolerances > DISPATCH.EXE > TRIP_STATUS_CHANGE_DATE

 The status of a trip can be viewed in the Dispatch application > Trips grid or any of the Multi Mode Dispatch application > trips grids. The status of an order can be viewed in the Customer Service application > Status tab

requestBody.description: A single JSON object containing the properties of the status change. Both the status code and zone must be sent with the request.
